global_flags.description: This  option indicates that all clients with top-level windows on the screen should be killed.  Xkill will ask you to select the root window with each of the currently defined buttons to give you several chances to abort.  Use of this option is highly discouraged.

option  specifies  the number of pointer button that should be used in selecting a window to kill.  If the word "any" is speci‐ fied, any button on the pointer may be used.  By default, the first button in the pointer map (which is usually the leftmost  button) is used.

This option indicates that xkill should ignore the standard conventions for finding top-level client  windows  (which  are  typically nested inside a window manager window), and simply believe that you want to kill direct children of the root.
If no resource is specified, xkill will dis‐ play a special cursor with which you should select a window to be kill.
